summary: This document is an email chain from February 2021 between a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and the FBI Victim Services unit. The victim expresses frustration over a delayed travel reimbursement promised for attending an FBI briefing intended to address the FBI's mishandling of the Epstein case. The correspondence shows administrative delays and communication issues regarding victim compensation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the perpetrator whose victims were invited to an FBI briefing.

events.title: Victim submits reimbursement paperwork to FBI
events.description: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein submits paperwork for travel expense reimbursement to the FBI Victim Services unit after attending an FBI briefing.

events.title: FBI acknowledges reimbursement processing
events.description: FBI Victim Services informs the victim that their reimbursement paperwork, submitted on November 16, is processing and should be expected in about 30 days.

events.title: FBI updates on delayed reimbursement
events.description: FBI Victim Services tells the victim the reimbursement transaction should go through in about 10 days, apologizing for the delay.

events.title: Victim complains about 3-month reimbursement delay
events.description: A victim emails the FBI expressing frustration that nearly 3 months have passed since an FBI briefing for Epstein victims, and promised travel reimbursements have not been received.

keyFacts: The FBI held a briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein to 'extend an olive branch' and address how the FBI 'messed up' the investigation.
Victims were promised reimbursement for travel expenses to attend the FBI briefing.
A victim experienced a significant delay (approaching 3 months) in receiving the promised reimbursement, indicating administrative problems within the FBI's victim services process.
The email chain reveals ongoing communication and frustration between a victim and the FBI Victim Services unit over financial compensation related to the case.
